intro: Bothriocline monocephala, commonly known as the single-headed screw vine, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many species with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its twisting stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
